intro: Oeceoclades analavelensis, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and vibrant colors. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its flowers are usually small, with intricate patterns that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
